summary: The Ute 100 Mile & 50 Mile is a high-altitude ultramarathon that circumnavigates the La Sal Mountains near Moab, Utah, offering a grueling course through one of the state's most remote ranges. Runners endure extreme vertical shifts while transitioning from iconic high-desert singletrack to technical alpine scree fields above the treeline.
uniqueFeatures: Reaches a peak elevation of 12,272 feet at Mann's Peak, making it the highest point of any sanctioned footrace in the state of Utah.
Features a massive elevation profile with approximately 25,000 feet of vertical gain for the 100-mile distance at an average altitude exceeding 8,700 feet.
Provides breathtaking panoramic views that contrast the lush alpine forests and snow-capped peaks of the La Sals with the red rock canyons of Moab and Castle Valley below.

media.title: Episode 82 - Sean Run Bum Blanton
media.summary: An in-depth interview with the race director discussing the vision behind the Ute 100, its difficulty, and the unique alpine-to-desert landscape of the route.
media.contentSummary: Host Rob Steger interviews ultra runner and race director Sean Blanton about his experiences in the sport and his work organizing races like the Georgia Death Race.
